greenVeggie.name: Swiss chard
greenVeggie.tip: Swiss chard helps keep your heart strong. Try it cooked like spinach.

greenVeggie.name: Broccoli
greenVeggie.tip: Broccoli gives you vitamin C. It tastes great steamed or roasted.

greenVeggie.name: Kale
greenVeggie.tip: Kale has lots of vitamins that help your body stay healthy. Try it in a smoothie or salad.

greenVeggie.name: Spinach
greenVeggie.tip: Spinach gives you iron to make you strong. Eat it raw or cooked.

greenVeggie.name: Asparagus
greenVeggie.tip: Asparagus is full of vitamins and tastes yummy roasted or grilled.

greenVeggie.name: Carrots
greenVeggie.tip: Carrots help your eyes stay healthy. Eat them raw or cooked.

greenVeggie.name: Beets
greenVeggie.tip: Beets help your blood stay healthy. Try them roasted or in a salad.

greenVeggie.name: Cucumbers
greenVeggie.tip: Cucumbers help you stay cool and hydrated. Eat them raw for a crunch!

greenVeggie.name: Peas
greenVeggie.tip: Peas give you protein and fiber. Add them to soups or rice.

greenVeggie.name: Onions
greenVeggie.tip: Onions add flavor to food. Cook them until soft for a sweeter taste.

greenVeggie.name: Green & yellow beans
greenVeggie.tip: Green and yellow beans help your muscles and bones. Eat them steamed or stir-fried.

greenVeggie.name: Tomatoes
greenVeggie.tip: Tomatoes are full of vitamin C. Try them fresh or in pasta sauce.

greenVeggie.name: Peppers
greenVeggie.tip: Peppers add color and crunch. Eat them raw or roasted for extra flavor.

yellowVeggie.name: Corn
yellowVeggie.tip: Corn gives you energy. Enjoy it boiled or grilled on the cob.

yellowVeggie.name: Potatoes
yellowVeggie.tip: Potatoes give you energy. Bake or roast them instead of frying.

greenFruit.name: Strawberries
greenFruit.tip: Strawberries have vitamin C and taste sweet. Eat them fresh or in yogurt.

greenFruit.name: Raspberries
greenFruit.tip: Raspberries are full of fiber. Eat them for a healthy snack.

greenFruit.name: Blueberries
greenFruit.tip: Blueberries help your brain stay sharp. Eat them with oatmeal or cereal.

greenFruit.name: Apples
greenFruit.tip: Apples are crunchy and full of fiber. Eat them with the skin on.

greenFruit.name: Cherries
greenFruit.tip: Cherries taste sweet and can help your body feel less sore after exercise.

greenFruit.name: Lemons
greenFruit.tip: Lemons are full of vitamin C. Squeeze some in your water for flavor.

greenFruit.name: Oranges
greenFruit.tip: Oranges help your immune system. Peel and eat for a juicy snack.

greenFruit.name: Pears
greenFruit.tip: Pears are soft and sweet. They help you stay regular because of fiber.

greenFruit.name: Peaches
greenFruit.tip: Peaches are juicy and full of vitamins. Eat them fresh or from a can in juice.

greenFruit.name: Watermelon
greenFruit.tip: Watermelon keeps you cool and hydrated. Eat it cold on a hot day.

yellowProtein.name: Eggs
yellowProtein.tip: Eggs help build muscles. Eat them scrambled, boiled, or in an omelet.

yellowProtein.name: Low-fat cheese
yellowProtein.tip: Low-fat cheese gives you calcium for strong bones. Enjoy a small slice for a snack.

yellowProtein.name: Chickpeas
yellowProtein.tip: Chickpeas give you energy and protein. Try them in a salad or roasted.

yellowProtein.name: Kidney beans
yellowProtein.tip: Kidney beans help your heart stay healthy. Eat them in chili or soup.

yellowProtein.name: Black beans
yellowProtein.tip: Black beans have protein and fiber. Mix them with rice or veggies.

yellowProtein.name: Navy beans
yellowProtein.tip: Navy beans give you energy and help your stomach feel full.

yellowProtein.name: Lentils
yellowProtein.tip: Lentils cook fast and are full of protein. Try them in soup or stew.

yellowProtein.name: Pinto beans
yellowProtein.tip: Pinto beans taste great in tacos or burritos. They give you energy too.

yellowProtein.name: Fish
yellowProtein.tip: Fish helps your brain and heart. Try it baked or grilled.

yellowProtein.name: Crab
yellowProtein.tip: Crab has protein to keep you strong. Eat it with lemon for extra flavor.

yellowProtein.name: Chicken
yellowProtein.tip: Chicken helps your muscles grow. Bake or grill it for a healthy meal.

yellowGrain.name: Whole wheat bread
yellowGrain.tip: Whole wheat bread gives you long-lasting energy. Use it for sandwiches.

yellowGrain.name: Whole wheat bun
yellowGrain.tip: Whole wheat buns are better than white buns. Try them for burgers or sandwiches.

yellowGrain.name: Whole grain cracker
yellowGrain.tip: Whole grain crackers are a good snack. Eat them with cheese or peanut butter.

yellowGrain.name: Unsweetened oatmeal
yellowGrain.tip: Oatmeal keeps you full and gives energy. Add fruit for extra flavor.

yellowGrain.name: Hard taco shell
yellowGrain.tip: Hard taco shells can be filled with beans, chicken, or veggies for a fun meal.
